awd_titl_txt: An Integrated Instrumentation Package for Undergraduate     Seismology
awd_abstract_narration: The University of Wisconsin, Oshkosh will purchase a 24-channel                 digital floating point seismograph, and an associated                           microcomputer.  This instrumentation will be used to improve                    instruction in undergraduate courses in geophysics, geological                  exploration, engineering geology, hydrology, and environmental                  geoscience by introducing students to the use of seismic                        techniques in these areas.  In addition the instruments will be                 used for independent projects by undergraduate students.  This                  project involves a collaborative effort between the physics                     department and geology department at UW, Oshkosh.                                                                                                               The NSF equipment grant will be matched by an equal contribution                from the University of Wisconsin, Oshkosh.  In addition, the                    University will provide $8.853 in summer salary support for the                 PI and Co-PI as an overmatch.
